answers.answer: I don't think you'll find answers on this forum but the following will provide you good leads. Keep in mind Pancreatic Islet Transplantation is and has been experimental with few success stories.Go here for a list of US Pancreatic Islet Transplantation Clinical Trials - recruiting, ongoing, and completed.http://diabetes.niddk.nih.gov/dm/pubs/pancreaticislet/In the US, organ transplants are handled by UNOS [United Network for Organ Sharing] from live donors or from a cadaver. You can drill down through the UNOS data base for all transplant centers [hospitals], what they do, what they have done year to date and past years, by organ type, gender, age, blood type, and so on.http://www.unos.org/Pancreatic Islet Transplant success storieshttp://www.google.com/search?hl=en&client=firefox-a&rls=org.mozilla:en-US:official&hs=VMP&ei=SEOwSvflEYH2sgPL-a2-Cw&sa=X&oi=spell&resnum=0&ct=result&cd=1&q=islets+transplantation+success+stories&spell=1
